results.title: Flipper the seal
results.brief_description: One of a series of films produced as a background for reading and expression. Following a visit to a zoo, one of the young visitors decides to learn more about seals. While he reads such words as “waves”, “swimming”, “dive” and “fur”, seals are shown in their natural surroundings swimming, playing and caring for their young. Other activities, such as clay modelling and writing a story about seals, are suggested as a class project.

results.title: Flipper
results.brief_description: Flipper the movie and subsequent television series alerted the world to the incredible intelligence of Dolphins. Chuck Connors plays Porter Ricks, a fisherman who does not value the dolphins in his fishing territory. His son Sandy develops a rapport with Flipper, a wounded dolphin, but finds himself in conflict with his father. Only when Flipper intervenes in a life-threatening situation can Porter appreciate the wonderful dolphin. Beautifully filmed, “Flipper” is a classic family fare.

results.title: Flip and two twisters
results.creator_credit: Point of View Productions, Robin Laing and Shirley Horrocks
results.brief_description: This illuminating documentary explores the career of New Zealand artist and filmmaker Len Lye, drawing on recently discovered footage of the artist discussing his pioneering ‘direct film’ technique and working on his large kinetic steel sculptures (beautifully shot by Leon Narby). New Zealand sculptor Evan Webb, who has dedicated his career to preserving the original intention and legacy of Len Lye, is interviewed about the process of realising some of Len Lye large scale projects posthumously. It is Lye’s lifetime study of movement that drives the content of the documentary. His purists explorations from his films to sculpture and his search for a sense of harmonics - ‘the natural frequency of materials’ is captured here. The film includes footage of his films “Colour box” (1935) and sculptures ‘Wind Wand’, ‘Round Head’, ‘Fountain’, ‘Blade’ and ‘Trilogy: Flip & Two Twisters’.

results.title: Flint miners of the Nullabor
results.creator_credit: S A Museum, Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies and Robert Edwards
results.brief_description: Koonalda Cave in the Nullabor had been worked as a flint quarry 20,000 years ago. Flint had been used by prehistoric man to fashion simple, functional implements. The first known ventures of Australians into the realm of art were discovered on the walls of the cave.
results.creator_credit_for_label: S A Museum, Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies and Robert Edwards

results.title: Flinder's Journey
results.brief_description:
This film comments on Matthew Flinders’ journey and personal experiences of new Australian states and his fascination with native life.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Flight: an anthology
results.brief_description: An anthology of verse, prose, music and film about flying. In an age of technicalities and super-sonic developments, the film recaptures the basic freedom of getting above the clouds.

results.title: Flight: a new awareness
results.brief_description: As young people fly with hang gliders and a pilot soars upwards in a glider plane, the pilot reflects on how despite the earth’s many wonders - humans have always envied the birds and longed to fly. Soaring higher and higher, the pilot experiences an exhilarating freedom and a whole new perspective of the earth below. The earth becomes a single, living organism - more beautiful than he ever imagined. He discovers how fragile a hold life has on this planet and dreams of a technology that refines and perfects, rather than destroys and pollutes.

results.title: Flight to Flinders
results.creator_credit: Tasmanian State Film Unit, Ray Barnes and Peter Young
results.brief_description: A brief tour of Flinders Island, Bass strait, showing its natural features, birds, and points of interest to visitors. Includes a good historical commentary, with some emphasis on the work done by early artists painting flora and fauna.

results.title: Flight plan
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Stanley Hawes
results.brief_description: The organisation of ciial aviation in Australia; the planning and control behind, and during, every flight; the training of pilots and maintenance staff; plans for the future development of the service. Also features the Royal Flying Doctor Service.

results.title: Flight of the rhino
results.creator_credit: Sky Visuals, Tina Dalton and Gary Steer
results.brief_description: No other large wild animal is being wiped out at the rate of Africa’s black rhino. If this rate of slaughter continues the black rhino may not survive this decade. This video shows the extraordinary efforts that are being made in an attempt to save this animal from extinction. in a bid to svave them, rhinos are being dehorned, poachers are being shot on sight and rhinos are being transported to safe areas within Zimbabwe and to captive breeding centres overseas. Following the journey of nine black rhinos taken from the wilds of Zimbabwe and flown to Western Plains Zoo in outback Australia. It is hoped that the offspring of this herd will one day be returned to their home in Zimbabwe.
